patterns: What kind of degree do you have
responses: Tom first studied Mathematics at the University of Oxford, then moved to the University of Bath to continue their studies into Mathematics with Data Science, where they are currently studying. You can ask me more about the scholarships they were awarded at both institutions if you want!

patterns: What kind of scholar are you
Did you get financial help as a scholar
responses: In Bath, Tom has been awarded the 'Global Leader Scholarship' and £5,000 off their tutition fees for recognition of his contributions to leadership positions worldwide, as well as their work volunteering internationally. They were also awarded a grant of £3,000 as an 'Expanding Horizons Scholar' whilst studing at Oxford to fund a 3 month trip to Lima, Peru to teach Mathematics to students.

patterns: where did you find the code for phil
responses: I was coded using the Pytorch Library and was trained on a minimal prescriptive intents.json file, as Tom believed it was too risky to train corpus on a larger dataset-so I don't claim things that are wrong! This does unfortunately mean I do not reply as conversationally. My code is in the github repo for the website under the file 'chatbot'. Tom is also working on a conversational chatbot trained on the Cornell Movie Corpus dataset, which you will see on the Projects page soon!
You can find a link the pdf form of Tom's CV on the Abouts page - Tom will code me to give it directly to you soon!

Tom has worked in a number of jobs and roles across Mathematics and Computer Science. I will list them here eventually, but highlights include being headhunted to join a startup as a backend dev after their reputation spread following two years working as the webmaster of their university student page where they took on several fullstack development projects.
